menu.fr: Comment le CO₂ stocke de l'energie

rocky place, far from civilisation and forests
daily and yearly cycles
60 years: 315 -> over 400 parts per million
Ordovician life existed with 8000 parts per million
Plants change chemical composition of atmosphere and...

legend.en:
Soil is a funny thing, in that it isn’t really anything in and of itself but is instead the product of two different worlds coming together. Soil is the naturally produced graffiti that results from tensions between the biological and geological realms...
All around us we can point concretely to what’s alive — a green leaf, a moving worm, a sucking root. At depth lies cold, hard rock, old as the hills..., and equally devoid of breath and movement — not alive. Everything that is physically located between the two extremes — alive and not alive — we call “soil.”
legend.fr:
Le sol est une chose étrange. Ce n'est pas vraiment une chose en soi. C'est plutôt le produit de deux mondes qui se rencontrent. Le sol est le graffiti qui est le résultat naturel des tensions entre les royaumes biologique et géologique...
Tout autour de nous, nous pouvons indiquer concrètement ce qui est vivant : une feuille verte, un vers qui bouge, une racine qui explore. Dans les profondeurs gît la roche, dure et froide, aussi vieille que la terre ... et complètement dépourvue de souffle et de mouvement — non vivante. Tout ce qui se trouve physiquement entre ces deux extrêmes – vivant et non vivant – nous l'appelons “le sol”.
legend.ru:
Почва - забавная штука, поскольку на самом деле это не что-то само по себе, а продукт объединения двух разных миров. Почва - это естественное граффити, возникающее в результате напряженности между биологической и геологической сферами ... 
Все вокруг нас мы можем конкретно указать на то, что живо - зеленый лист, движущийся червяк, сосущий корень. В глубине лежит холодный, твердый камень, старый, как холмы ... и столь же лишенный дыхания и движения - не живой. Все, что физически находится между двумя крайностями - живым и неживым, - мы называем «почвой».

notes: living things die
their bodies pile up
Q: Where do the bodies of plants come from?
> 400 years ago, A: 'the soil'

legend.ru: Ян Баптиста Ван Гельмонт (с. 1579 г. - 1644 г.)

notes: Kepler, Galileo, Descartes
born in Brussels
died in Vilvoorde, Spanish Netherlands

phrases.html:
gas (n)

1650s, from Dutch gas, probably from Greek khaos "empty space" (see chaos). The sound of Dutch "g" is roughly equivalent to that of Greek "kh." First used by Flemish chemist J.B. van Helmont (1577-1644), probably influenced by Paracelsus, who used khaos in an occult sense of "proper elements of spirits" or "ultra-rarified water," which was van Helmont's definition of gas.

Hunc spiritum, incognitum hactenus, novo nomine gas voco ("This vapor, hitherto unknown, I call by a new name, 'gas.'") [Helmont, Ortus Medicinae]

Modern scientific sense began 1779...

Source: Online Etymology Dictionary
notes: distinguish CO₂: gas/spiritus sylvester
origin of word? ghost? Gäscht (froth of fermentation)
rich father, fifth child, advantageous marriage 1609
God has given me a pious and noble wife. I retired with her to Vilvorde and there for seven years I dedicated myself to pyrotechny and to the relief of the poor.

word 'scientist' won't exist for 200 years

Live mass:
65% water, 33% CO₂, 2% nitrogen, magnesium, phosphorus
irony
62 lb wood => 61 lb 'wood gas'
He made the notes, he didn't connect the dots
discovered oxygen (dephlogisticated air)
invented carbonated water
added bubbles of 'fixed air' from fermenting beer to water
medicinal properties < scurvy цинга, скорбу́т
business failed
Erasmus Darwin (Charles's grandfather) made it popular among society friends
Experiments with candles and mice
'injured' the air
Add mint plant: mouse revives, candle continues to burn
March 1775, he gave a lecture on dephlogisticated air
five or six times better than common air for the purpose of respiration, inflammation, and, I believe, every other use of common atmospherical air.
visited Priestley in 1799
in the presence of light, plants give off bubbles from their green part
in the shade, the bubbles eventually stop
identified the gas as oxygen
noted that mass of the plant increased because of its absorption of carbon dioxide
Two uncomfortable truths:
Stuff that is not alive can become alive
The bulk of the mass of plants comes from air

menu.fr: La lumière du soleil devient matière

notes: Carbon and oxygen want to be together

When you burn wood "the light and heat that's coming out, that's the light and heat of the sun that went in. So it's sort of 'stored sun' that's coming out."
And that's where the soil comes from.
Learing nothing new
You know about climate change, how trees store carbon
Burning fossil fuels releases it
If that's the only magic, we can go home now.
Started with time lapse of grass growing...
...to hit a spot on a river
In the second video...

legend.en: #Charles Darwin, "[The Power of Movement in Plants](http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/5605)", 1877 (final sentence)#It is hardly an exaggeration to say that *the tip of the radicle* thus endowed [with sensitivity] and having the power of directing the movements of the adjoining parts, *acts like the brain* of one of the lower animals; the brain being seated within the anterior end of the body, receiving impressions from the sense-organs, and directing several movements.
legend.fr: #Charles Darwin, "[La Faculté motrice dans les plantes](https://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/bpt6k5683513x/f10.image.texteImage)", 1877 (dernière phrase)#Il n'est guère exagéré de dire que *la pointe de la radicule* ainsi douée [de sensibilité] et ayant le pouvoir de diriger les mouvements des parties voisines*, *agit comme le cerveau* d'un des animaux inférieurs; le cerveau étant assis dans l'extrémité antérieure du corps, recevant des impressions des organes des sens, et dirigeant plusieurs mouvements.
legend.ru: #Дарвин Чарлз Роберт, "[Движения Растений](http://books.e-heritage.ru/book/10070769)", 1877 (последнее предложение)#Едва ли будет преувеличением сказать, что кончик корешка, наделенный спосабностью направлять двежения сосендих частей, действует подобно мозгу одного из низших животных, находящемуся в переднем конце тела. воспринимающему впечатления от органов чувств и дающему направление различным движениям.

Your nose exquisitely sensitive, can detect fewer than 1 part in a billion.
